result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J Myers

records.addlTxt:
2:06 PM (64-06) Defendant Justin J Myers in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Justin J Myers.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Herrmann in court. 
Attorney Uzowulu made a record.  Defendant is requesting more time to possibly retain private counsel. Defense is requesting three weeks. 
No objection by the State. 

Adj. 2:08PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Request to Lift the No Contact. Control Plan filed.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin J Myers in court.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appears with the defendant - he was just appointed. Atty. Uzowulu goes over the charges and penalties with the defendant and requests preliminary hearing outside the time limits. Court sets as requested.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.J.G. dob 3-18-1980. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4202 thru 4205

Defendant Justin J Myers in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Josh Ryan appeared for bond purposes only. Signature bond set, Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
